Author: jspook16#3059
Content: I've got an idea. Can we use KV for a simple messagaging system in hyperdedx/barterdex? We can make the komodo address the key for direct messaging, a broadcast key for all, use an asset chain different from komodo to keep messaging cheap. What do you guys think? it may be a bit delayed ...

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: nevermind.....delay is about a min

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: thats too long for chat

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: @jspook16 you could try with a faster block time but not sure its possible...however there should be a way. Also regarding distributed storage this is in the frontier with ipfs file storage. I think KV could point to ipfs files, so there would be higher limit regarding media or attachments

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content:
and btw I'm interested to play with this at some point for in-wallet chat application, seems tech behind wouldnt be much complicated...remember we just need a whitelabel thing so anyone can apply to its software, its the only way to get a sensible chat volume that can make the system survive. 

Something simple, easy, that just works. SPV clients are becoming more and more easy to build, so maybe it would be nice idea to make it available for any SPV client from scratch

And I would say to forget about paying for messging, that would leave the system out of availability for a loot of users. Remember when they asked to pay for whatsapp?  well nobody remembers because that didnt lasted long

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: yeah that sounds like what I was thinking. I guess i didnt mean actually "pay", i meant we could use an asset chain that didn't really have much value ,,,,kind of like a doge coin

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: something we can airdrop or just give out (assuming we needed  an asset chain) . Could just use a messaging server like openfire or soemthing

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: @kimmel (Pungo.io) I'm glad someone else is thinking about this too

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: I'm taking a look at openfire, the problem about starting from scratch is that we will probably find the same problems that already have been solved by many projects out there

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: so feels like reinventing the wheel

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: I'm not sure that is good or not...like saying "I'll do with blockchain and will work out of the box"...and then finding...maybe this guys were right about this, this this..this...and ending up solving the same problems already solved on many messaging systems out there

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: KV thing its an interesting feature for many things, especially using IPFS with it

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: if we add to this the "scaling " capabilities of KMD based chains

Author: jspook16#3059

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: things get interesting

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: however maybe someone at komodo could help us by developing something that "just works" for any project to use it

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: @pbca26 did a great job with agama desktop and mobile, pungo wouldnt be there without him

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: and many other wallets either, wouldnt be there without pushing agama codebase forward

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: so KV chain + ipfs + scaled kmd chains seem a good solution that might work for usage in many projects...from chat, to file storage (dropbox alternative) or whatever
